page.title: 01NAILSTONE
page.content: {Nailstone}is situated about three kilometres south of Ibstock and four kilometres north of Market Bosworth. Nailstone stands about 450 feet above sea level with the land sloping away gently to three sides. To the north east the land slopes gradually upwards to join the Charnwood Range. The village borders the A447 which was once the main road south to London. There are 349 adults on the 1984 electoral role in Nailstone, whereas there were 179 adults in the village in 1851 out of a total of{population} of 343.{ {First settlement}of the area was probably between 650 and 750 A.D. This would have been on the village green which can still be seen as the area around the church which is enclosed by roads, and otherwise only houses the more modern buildings.
